newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire delays new government to next week - radio.
newsitem.headline: Zaire delays new government to next week - radio.

text.p: President Mobutu Sese Seko has given Zaire's political leaders until early next week to nominate a crisis government to guide the country in its war against Rwandan-backed rebels, state radio said on Saturday.

The radio report, quoting Mobutu's security adviser Honore Ngbanda, was broadcast as a Saturday deadline given by Mobutu to the country's bickering politicians to come up with ideas on a new government passed without a sign of progress.
"Marshal Mobutu responded positively to a 48-hour extension of time requested by the politicians," the Voice of Zaire said.
Party leaders expect a new government to be in place by Monday.
